With this map and its detailed one-shot adventure prompt, you’ll save so much time as you prepare for a fun session. The battlemap comes ready for both VTTs and easy home (or professional) printing—so you can use it no matter how you prefer to run your sessions!

boardgame.name: Broken Astral Crystal Prison
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Brilliant, star-filled space gives way to this astral prison. Light bridges lead to shattered blue crystals, where demonic prisoners have escaped.

With this map and its detailed one-shot adventure prompt, you’ll save so much time as you prepare for a fun session. The battlemap comes ready for both VTTs and easy home (or professional) printing—so you can use it no matter how you prefer to run your sessions!

boardgame.name: Undercity Criminal Sewers
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Inhabited sewers, fit with prison cells, ad-hoc bridges, and different living areas.

With this multi-level map and its detailed one-shot adventure prompt, you’ll save so much time as you prepare for a fun session. The battlemap comes ready for both VTTs and easy home (or professional) printing—so you can use it no matter how you prefer to run your sessions!

boardgame.name: Lock 'n Load Tactical: Heroes Against the Red Star – Red Gauntlet
boardgame.description:
The Red Army Moves West Expansion for Heroes Against the Red Star

Red Gauntlet is an expansion for Heroes Against the Red Star from the Lock ‘n Load Tactical System. Included are eight brand-new scenarios and a new map. It features fluid, impulse-based turns, squad-level actions, and individual heroics. The scenarios span the entire length of the war, starting with the first American counterattacks in the Gap and desperate efforts to slow down the Soviet juggernaut. We see Soviet Separate Air battalions landing to clear the way for armored spearheads and vicious ambushes against columns of Soviet vehicles.

There are armored formations clashing outside of Frankfurt. We see the French desperately attempting to hold the Soviets at bay in bitter fighting on the streets of Paris and daring rear area raids on supply depots, and the combined NATO last desperate final attempt to stop the Soviet Black Guards Tank Division from reaching Le Havre, and splitting the NATO line from north and south France.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Lock 'n Load Tactical: Heroes Against the Red Star

boardgame.name: Hunted: Santa's Workshop
boardgame.description:
Everyone was happily working on toys and getting ready for Christmas when all of a sudden Jack Frost and an army of minions showed up. They kidnapped Santa, scattered the elves, and are trying to ruin Christmas!

Now, you’ll have to work your way through the North Pole and rescue Santa before Christmas is canceled... all while Jack Frost’s minions try to hunt you down...

Overview:
Take on the role of one of Santa’s elves in order to sneak your way through the North Pole, defeat Jack Frost, rescue Santa, and save Christmas. But be wary, Jack's minions are searching for you to put a premature end to your holiday heroics. Collect weapons, recruit other elves, avoid capture, and find Santa before time runs out and Christmas is ruined!

This game takes Gabe Barrett's "HUNTED" cooperative card-game system and adds a holiday flair. There was a VERY limited physical print run of the game made available as a 'secret bonus' only to backers of the "Hunted: Wode Ridge" Kickstarter campaign in early 2021. A print-and-play version is currently available to download for free.

boardgame.name: The Ruby Guard
boardgame.description:
From Introduction:

The New King

When Giomel ascended to the throne, few thought he was ready to be king. But in truth, it was the other way around. His court was not ready for him. A younger son, he had always assumed his older brother would inherit the crown, and so he devoted himself to studies of magic, obscure history, and the occult. He was no battlefield general, no politician, no speech-maker. And yet, his head was not devoid of ideas either.

Where once he had been content to let the world unfold around him, the taste of power set fi re to his ambitions. He looked over the kingdom that was newly his and thought it weak, vulnerable, just like its neighbours. But if they were weak, they could make him strong. He would not even have to invade them—a projection of strength would make them flock to his banner, and kneel before him gladly. If he did it right, they would be beneath his boot before they even knew it.

But where to start? Giomel proclaimed himself the new Monster King, and surrounded himself with a terrifying retinue of warriors, the Ruby Guard. He wanted to be feared, and their fearful appearance worked. Bedecked in long, foreign feathers, with the helmets of their bronzed and gilded armour made to look like hideously twisted faces, these bodyguards cut a striking figure. But when the serrated blades of their swords cut flesh, the true horror starts, as their blood magic does its work. How could any assassin reach the king when the heat is leeched from their body faster than the liquid from their veins? As their limbs grow heavy, the Ruby Guard can finish their work with ease.

The first step in King Giomel’s plan is complete. He has protection from assassins and his name rings out. But he still has no monsters, not real ones at least. But he has made it be known that any of those not human who wish to conduct trade with the people of his realm are welcome, and he has embraced the envoys of strange beings as equals. Who knows? Perhaps not long from now there will be monsters among his Ruby Guards, and his new name will be more than empty words and bluster.

boardgame.name: Infinity Casino
boardgame.description:
In this betting game, players are allowed to write any number on their blank dry erase chips. However, if you have the highest number out of all the players, you cannot win the bet; and if you bet the lowest number, you will be fined. If you are in the middle when the number is rolled, you will win your bet.

The winner of the game is the player with the most moeny at the end.

boardgame.name: Warlock Patron: Krampus
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Several winter traditions revolve around festivals of gift-giving, gratitude, and hope for the new year, where good deeds and kindness throughout the year are rewarded with treats and presents. However, the children of the northern mountains also recognize the shorter days as a herald to the grim inquisition of Krampus. A reclusive devil exiled to the material plane, Krampus takes a particularly cruel delight in meting out justice to those who would think themselves above mortal law.

Building off of the existing Fifth Edition rules to build a warlock character, Krampus grants warlocks sinister powers to punish wrongdoers, all while tempting them to go too far in the name of revenge so that they, in turn, are punished by Krampus's other warlocks. This PDF also includes three additional eldritch invocations to further cement the holiday flavor of Christmas warlock option.

boardgame.name: Candyland
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Lady Yule is well known for giving out candy during the holiday season but this year she has a problem. Her major supplier is ill and has not been able to create the treats. Fortunately, she has enlisted the help of a local Druid but she needs your party to go get it!

This adventure setting was designed for 5th Edition AD&D for the Filbar Campaign for a quartet of adventurers (1st level) and a DM.

boardgame.name: The Lost Valley
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is the fourth in TavernMaster Games' new line of solitaire and GM adventures for Tunnels & Trolls™ ; 'Dekh's Dollar Downloads'. The emphasis for these products is to maintain our high production values while achieving real value for money and giving you more roleplaying bang for your buck.

The Lost Valley is a small GM adventure for the Tunnels and TrollsTM role playing system. It has been written for all modern editions of the rules; 5th onwards. It is intended for a party of experienced adventurers but can be run for any level of characters with adaptations to monster strengths and saving roll levels. It can be run as a stand-alone adventure or slotted into an existing wilderness campaign.

Player-Characters find themselves in a strange valley; created many thousands of years ago when a cataclysmic tectonic event caused a plateau with a river running through it to drop some 500’ and cut off the land and animals from the territory above. There are unusually large flying insects and crawling beasts, strange plant life and bizarre trees, the likes of which the adventurers will have never seen. The birds flying overhead, are huge and many have leathery wings. The air is filled with ash and dust, and the sky is dark and gloomy. They have ventured into a land before time began; adventure awaits ...

If you are a fan of Jurassic Park, B-Movies, Monster-flicks & Dinosaurs then this adventure is right up your gaming alley!

boardgame.name: Barkeeper's Order Trick
boardgame.description: Play a series of simultaneous tricks to buy spirits for your bar. The inner trick sets the range allowed by the outer trick. The winner of the outer trick takes the cards and arranges them by type. Whoever has the most types of spirits at the end of the hand has stocked their bar the best and wins the game.

boardgame.name: Gothic Horror
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Feel the Thrill!

The Gothic Horror deck takes you on a trip through a haunted mansion. Expect secret passages, peeling wallpapers, suspicious shadows, and hair-raising, weird, and eerie encounters that will satisfy all your needs from Ravenloft to Bly Manor.

boardgame.name: Sailing the Clouds
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Sail through the Clouds!

The Sailing the Clouds deck takes you on the adventure aboard an airship, whether you're into fantasy or steampunk - or anything in between. From fantastical monsters to seemingly mundane happenings, no trip will be the same.

boardgame.name: Surreal Carnival
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Step Right Up!

The Surreal Carnival deck takes you on a trip through a mysterious carnival, full of exciting games, colorful personalities, puzzles, riddles, and more than one reason to look deep into the character's soul. Discover what lies behind the mirrors, behold the monsters held in cages, and lift the weights you didn't know you're carrying.

boardgame.name: The Dark Forest
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Choose Your Path Carefully

Just a short hike through the forest, they said. But now, the sun is setting, the sky is ablaze, and the mushrooms are looking at you weirdly. Did you take a wrong turn somewhere? Have you seen this place before?

Are you... Lost?

There's a pale light shining between the trees, and as you carefully consider your choices... A deck of cards appears in front of you. You draw one. Hopefully not your last.

The Dark Forest deck takes you on a trip through eerie, mysterious woods, where the laws of time and physics find themselves otherwise occupied. Fey creatures, mysterious lights, suspicious villagers, wolfseekers, white rabbits, paths leading you astray... The adventurers will get lost in the Dark Forest - perhaps for the last time.

boardgame.name: Underwater Kingdoms
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Take a deep dive into the adventure

Everything seemed so close when you took a deep breath and plunged into the water. Now, your vision has shifted, and the sounds are overwhelming, coming at you from each direction. Numerous, colorful fish are swimming as you as you investigate the strange stone embedded in the sandy seabed. Are those carvings among the barnacles?

Wayfarer's Deck: Underwater Kingdoms takes you for dangerous, mysterious, and surprising adventures beneath the waves. From curious octopuses to hunting merfolk, to strange sounds, and murky depths, the adventurers will have more than enough opportunities to prove their courage, preparedness, and willpower. The depths are as wondrous as they are unforgiving.

boardgame.name: Seas & Oceans
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

What's growing beneath the waves?

Plant-wise? Not that much. But algae can still be green and fascinating, and there is no reason not to allow the players to enjoy the incredible biodiversity of oceans. From microscopic phytoplantkon to giant kelp and glowing orbs, there is greenery to be found and adventures to be shared.

Take up the challenge and upgrade your world-building game with Globetrotter's Guide to Greenery. Your setting, your campaigns, and your players will all be happy you did!

boardgame.name: The Trapper Conclave
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A new Ranger sub-class for 5E that focuses on traps and restricting creatures movement across a battlefield.

NOTE: Designed with grid-based combat in mind. If you are playing a theater of the mind style game, this sub-class will be greatly hindered. Talk to your GM about what style of combat your campaign will have.

boardgame.name: Goblin Caves
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Monstrous Lair #49 Goblin Caves provides you—the busy, time-crunched GM—with the details to effortlessly bring to life the goblin caves in your campaign.

Are you a busy GM? Does session prep take too long? Do you never have time to work on the cool little details that can bring your adventures, dungeons and campaign to life? This short, focused compilation gives you, the time-crunched GM, the tools to effortlessly add verisimilitude and detail to your dungeons. Use the material herein either before or during play and bask in your players' adulation.

boardgame.name: Sumac Berries
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Know, o wanderer, that between the myriads when the Starless Seas rose and drank the gleaming spires of Gods and the time of the rising of the Queen of Swords, that there was a realm more dreamlike than a dream, lay spread across the Spheres like blue mantles beneath the stars - topless towers of gold, hills and valleys alive with music, rivers and forests splashing and swaying without wind. A priceless jewel in the dreaming west…

Sumac Berries is #5 in a series of short hex- and dungeon-crawls for the PINKHACK system, but are easily adaptable to the OSR system of your choice. Each DOOMCRAWL is inspired by the iconic Special Herbs beat tracks by MF DOOM.

What's in this edition?

2d6 Rumors heard of the Dreaming West
1d20 Misfortunes befalling unwary expeditions
10 hexes to explore
9 1d6 Discovery tables with Encounters, Treasure, and NPCs
17 pages of Adventure

boardgame.name: A Touch of Challenge: House Rules
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Do you feel like 5th Edition D&D isn't providing enough challenge for your characters? Do you find it frustrating that every single class can do magic? Do you want to bring back some of the feel of older games, but you're generally happy with the rule system?

These house rules were created for a personal game, but have been stable and working well for a number of years.

boardgame.name: The Emissary
Heroic Armory: Supply Drop IX
Heroic Armory: Supply Drop Vol. IX
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to Aedrenar! A New Post-Apocalyptic Fantasy World full of adventure, designed for masked vigilantes and treasure hunters alike!

Need some new equipment and items for your would-be vigilante? This book introduces a mix of new weapons and equipment useful for any self-respecting crime-fighter or half-decent detective.

Each volume in this new series details a small bit of backstory behind one of Aedrenar's greatest heroes (or villians), and provides some information about some of the gear they carried with them at different times. The best thing, is these heroes have long since had their time (or are prone to lending gear out to fellow heroes), so it can be used in creating your own!

Heroic Armory is a sourcebook for the Aedrenar Campaign Setting, which details new rules for outfitting powerful heroes. It includes a new 'Iconic Artifact' system, as well as numerous new magical devices that are useful to any character!1

boardgame.name: Prismatic Cyclopedia Classes
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Prismatic Cyclopedia Classes is a compendium intended to be used with any OSR game that keeps close to the original rules. But this is not just a re-imagining of the character classes, this is also a handy guide for players and GMs alike:

Classic Hooks
Tropes and Tools

Alignment
A discussion of the alignments
Tips on role-playing alignemts

Languages
A discussion of alignments as "languages"

The Classes
Cleric, Fighter, Magic-User, Thief, Dwarf, Elf, Halfling
A discussion on clerics and alignment

Advanced Options
The Death Save

Dual-Classing


If you play in an OSR game, from OSE to Lamentations, you owe it to yourself to check out this compendium.

boardgame.name: Allies & Adversaries
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

And we're back!!! All that good fisticuffs from the former days. In these action packed pages you'll find First Level and Monster versions of Countess, Doll Man, Copy Boy, Cormoran, Thinker, Whiz Kid, Jaguar Man, Butterfly, Whistler, Magno and my own home brew campaign NPCS: Emerald Squire and Emerald Lance.

boardgame.name: World of Tanks Miniatures Game: Tank Garage
boardgame.description:
Transport and store your tanks in style with the World of Tanks: Miniatures Game Garage (carry case).

Obviously with the world the way it is, tournaments, and group gaming opportunities are few and far between at the moment, but as well as transport, this provides a protective storage solution for keeping your platoon safe and neat in between battles, whilst also proudly displaying the World of Tanks: Miniatures Game logo.

Made from high quality, hard-wearing, water-resistant, durable black material and featuring branded embroidered stitching, and a velcro patch on top to allow for patch customisation.

12″ wide, 8″ deep, and 5.5″ high, it’s big enough to hold a whole platoon and more.

Inside you’ll find 3 laser cut foam trays. 2 that hold 7 tanks each, suitable for all sizes in the range and another for dice, cards, tokens etc.

This is the perfect solution for storing & transporting your platoons, ready for battle.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Saving Yule
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Happy holidays dear friends, and welcome to our thrilling winter adventure in the world of Svilland Campaign Setting. The inhabitants of this Norse-themed grim try to survive between wealth, fame and death. Svilland is a ruthless place to live; with its people, its cold climate and wild monsters. The weak are eliminated and the strong always need to prove their worth. Adventurers that do so are rewarded with treasure, fame or an honorable death. This story focuses on the Nordic winter festival called Yule, and is loosely related to another tradition; the Wild Hunt.
Players! Prepare for a mysterious adventure in the freezing cold of Svilland. Get ready to become fearless Svillanders who live in these unforgiving lands, untamed by civilization, where Black Winter looms over the very existence of all you see, where the Vanir once walked beneath the tall trees. Perhaps, if you have courage and luck on your side, you can uncover the secrets of these cold woods.

This adventure is designed for four 1st level characters. By the end of the story they should be 3rd level. At the very end, it is possible for you to extend the story in several ways. You can build your story by following one of these adventure hooks, and turn this short story into a campaign. The characters begin the adventure as fellow villagers from a settlement called Hoyskog. With roughly 200 inhabitants, this small, remote village is far from civilization. During the adventure, characters will look behind a curtain and reveal a dark truth. If they follow their curiosity and defeat everything that opposes them, they will become real heroes of their village; ready to venture forth into the world of Svilland.

boardgame.name: The Fachan
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Ugly is the make of the Fachan.
There is one eye in the middle of his head,
one arm in the middle of his chest,
one leg in the middle of his haunch,
and one tuft on the top of his head.
And it would be easier to pull a mountain up by the root than to bend one hair of that tuft.

Fachans are solitary marauders, haunting the bleakest and most inhospitable parts of the Scottish Highlands. A few have been encountered in Ireland.

boardgame.name: Kavouras Trader
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Kavouras colonial freighter got off to a bad start, with a reputation for poor reliability. However, the majority had recalls done and became an acceptable and useful ship. Intended as a colonial freighter, it carries 55 low berths, quite useful for kidnapping people and selling them as slaves to the best payer.
The Kavouras supplement contains details of the ship, A3 deck plans and a scenario to use either when one player can’t make it, or if only one player shows up. You also get an NPC crew to use with the scenario and details of suitable worlds to use.

boardgame.name: Waifu - Stripping Clothes
Waifu Sexy Time
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Rock-Paper-Scissors where you can undress your waifu to her underwear - loose and you have to watch advertisements...

boardgame.name: Adventure Avenue: Raiders of the Dark Spire
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Porphyran adventure set in the Haunted Sea for four characters of 10th level.

Ice giants are on the march. Villages have been razed, with only scant few survivors left alive. Reports from these survivors tell me that the perpetrators are blue-skinned giants of some sort and loot and pillage indiscriminately. They go for the portable riches, but they seem to dedicate a lot of time to gathering food and kidnapping villagers as well.

Can the PCs stop the Dark Spire raiders from consuming the Haunted Sea in their blood reign?

boardgame.name: Pact of the Sauter-Méduse
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A warlock who serves the sauter-méduse pledges themselves to find powerful magical artifacts for their patron to feed on, and grow fat from. The eldritch beast beneath the waves resembles a gargantuan jellyfish, with tendrils hundreds of feet long, who consume and contains vestiges of arcane power like a living, hungry vault. Their warlocks borrow power in the form of these tendrils and power over magical items, sometimes of their own free will, and often to earn the safety of themselves or their homes.

This product features the otherwordly patron option a warlock can take at 1st level, seven eldritch invocation options they may take, and the NPC stat block for the sauter-méduse itself, a CR 22 elemental complete with lair actions and relevant lore.

boardgame.name: Orc Caves
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Monstrous Lair #50 Orc Caves provides you—the busy, time-crunched GM—with the details to effortlessly bring to life the orc caves in your campaign.

Are you a busy GM? Does session prep take too long? Do you never have time to work on the cool little details that can bring your adventures, dungeons and campaign to life? This short, focused compilation gives you, the time-crunched GM, the tools to effortlessly add verisimilitude and detail to your dungeons. Use the material herein either before or during play and bask in your players' adulation.

boardgame.name: Treasury of the Pharaohs (PF2)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Tombs and Treasures of the Pyramids!

This supplement brings you over 30 Pathfinder Second Edition magical items ideal for explorers in an ancient kingdom of pharaohs and pyramids, a land of deserts and tombs, verdant oases and dusty wadis, soaring monolithic temples and seedy back streets and black markets. These items are perfect fodder for tomb robbers of every stripe, uncovering long-lost ruins once hidden by the sands or forbidden to outsiders, but now ready to join a daring rush into the dangerous marketplace of artifacts and antiquities. From glittering gold and lush lapis to alabaster, ivory, papyrus, and faience, the treasures of the pharaonic kingdom fire the imagination of treasure hunters the world over, who stand ready to defy mummy guardians, swarming scarabs, and eldritch curses that threaten doom upon any who would violate their sacred burial spaces. Their rest disturbed, tyrants and terrors that have long slumbered may rise to bring ruin upon lands that had forgotten them, but no warning or risk is too great when the plunder of dynasties awaits just behind the next dune.

This tome contains Pathfinder Second Edition treasures of great value to tomb robbers and guardians alike, like the map cartouche and tomb warden's stele, along with deadly weapons like the scarab scourge and dune trap javelin to protective gear like the dynast aegis and mail of the radiant pharaoh. These items are redolent with the mysteries and magic of the desert, like the oasis mirror and faience idols to the alabaster icons of Bast and the canopic chest of eternal repose! If your players hunger for the riches of the ages and to garb themselves like the god-kings of old, they are going to love what they find in the Treasury of the Pharaohs for Pathfinder 2E!

boardgame.name: Kami Eidolons
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A little something extra for your PF2 game!

The kami are spirits that live in the world, both in places of nature and also things built by humanoid hands, and they're perfect candidates for your summoner in Pathfinder Second Edition to tap into when calling upon their eidolons to serve. Within these pages you'll find two new eidolon types, the tsukomogami rooted in otherwise ordinary objects that can surprise your foes with Mundanity and a Startling Shift as well as unbound kami that can be used to Establish Ward and Defend Ward as perfect protectors!

boardgame.name: A Little Knowledge is a Dangerous Thing
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Players have death on their minds as they explore the famed Kurstwahl University and its highly secure Library.

A Little Knowledge is a Dangerous Thing is part of the Kurstwahl Gambit adventure series for Guild of Shadows and focuses on the Assassin as the central character. Not featured in the Guild of Shadows campaign setting book, this adventure can be played with a single player or a group.

boardgame.name: Just a Walk in the Park
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Larceny abounds as players seek to steal secrets from the Hoplat Winery. Not featured in the Guild of Shadows campaign setting book, this adventure can be played with a single player or a group.

Just a Walk in the Park is part of the Kurstwahl Gambit adventure series for Guild of Shadows and focuses on the Burglar archetype as the central character.

boardgame.name: Into the Lion's Den
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Infiltrating the Davinian Embassy is no easy task, and getting out alive will require planning and luck! Not featured in the Guild of Shadows campaign setting book, this adventure can be played with a single player or a group.

Into the Lion's Den is part of the Kurstwahl Gambit adventure series for Guild of Shadows and focuses on the Spy archetype as the central character.

boardgame.name: Dread Calm
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Undead Pirates. Vicious Dragon. Stay Calm.

SHOTGLASS ROUNDS are PDF-only One-Shots for 5e for the DM who doesn’t like to prep! Flexible, convenient, super-charged excitement in a compact package that won’t have you sitting up for hours doing prep for your next game session! Each adventure is designed for a 4-5 hour game and includes 2 new monsters, 2 new magic items, a full-size player’s map with grid & a full-size grid-less player’s map!

boardgame.name: Blak-Hawg Down
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Archaeological Dig. Uninvited Guest. Dark Secret.

SHOTGLASS ROUNDS are PDF-only One-Shots for 5e for the DM who doesn’t like to prep! Flexible, convenient, super-charged excitement in a compact package that won’t have you sitting up for hours doing prep for your next game session! Each adventure is designed for a 4-5 hour game and includes 2 new monsters, 2 new magic items, a full-size player’s map with grid & a full-size grid-less player’s map!
